TopicTitle: [0.21] Kerbal LiveFeed: Passive Multiplayer Plugin/Client/Server v0.7.1

Articles.Content: Does this mod work with 0.20.1 i really wanna get back into it but, i don't know if it works.

Rockhem,

it works just fine. (make sure to get the latest version, currently 0.6.5)

Another thought, did you change the HTTP (80) port, or the Default port (2075)? If you only changed the Default, try changing the HTTP (Again, you may have already tried this, I'm just trying to fire things to ya )

Tried changing just one or just the other or both at once.

I am pretty much at the point where I am willing to just give up because I cannot get this working for the life of me.

I've even tried changing what port I am listening on entirely to see if its just 7777 it doesnt like. 2075 as you mention doesnt work. 8080 doesnt work. 6677 didnt work. Head smashing the numpad to get random numbers didnt work either. It just seems that on my system this application cannot open any Http port regardless of firewall access (tried turning that off completely), admin mode, other applications running etc etc.

6677,

you could just use any of the existing servers... there are quite a few, and they work fine.

for list, look here ->> http://klf-info.general-physics.de/

I know many people want 'there own' server, but ... perhaps try out using one of the existing ones first?

some are low use, and if you wanted 'just you and your friends' it likely wouldn't be too hard to find one that isn't being used and your friends can all connect to that one.

Released minor update with plugin option to hide ship icons and server security.

Released minor update with plugin option to hide ship icons and server security.

Awesome Sodium, keep up the great work!

-Improved server flood prevention

would this aid to prevent Snapshot spamming, or does it ALSO aid in the prevention of Text spamming?

This question relates to an issue that ocoured recently where a spammer jumped into a well used KLF server, and made it unusable for over 2 hours.

I had heard about that and I'm sorry I wasn't online at the time to see it. I may provide some secure contact information to a couple people, or put up a public email address for cases like those.

Edit: You can now email oops[\at/]kerbalsp[\dot/]com if there's anymore issues with the server.

Made an edit, duh!

Oops, wrong thread. Seems like a cool mod though.

Sodium, thanks for that 0.6.6 option to hide ships. I mean.. with 35+ ppl on main server it was really .. crowdy.

cheers.
is a quick review of this, a lot of people are asking for one.

Guys, looks like the mod didnt work properly. Any help?

P.s. mod ver.0.6.6, KSP ver 0.20.2.186

Grek,

1) start KLF, connect

2) THEN start KSP

3) do not Alt-tab while ksp loads.

4) proffit

(note, as long as you connect KLF before you LOAD YOUR SAVE in KSP, and you didn't ever hit ALT-TAB, you will be fine).
I can alt tab if I run KSP in windowed mode...
Okay I would really appreciate the help if I can get it. I want to do a small server with just my friend and I believe I have successfully started a server, now how does my friend join it?

Okay I would really appreciate the help if I can get it. I want to do a small server with just my friend and I believe I have successfully started a server, now how does my friend join it?

He has to use your IP to join and that Ip should be public one, however what is a standard port for this, I do not know.

He has to use your IP to join and that Ip should be public one, however what is a standard port for this, I do not know.

Okay here is the server info:

Port: 8080

Http Port: 80

... and the rest is just server options

I really like where this mod is going! I have a question regarding mods: is it possible to play with mods (the example seems to show KSPX), and if so are all the players required to have the same mods and the same versions?

I really like where this mod is going! I have a question regarding mods: is it possible to play with mods (the example seems to show KSPX), and if so are all the players required to have the same mods and the same versions?

Players are not actually in your game, they appear in your game as place holders, so mods are not a problem at all!

Coz, as you can see from the OP, KLF doesn't care what other mods users are running.

Because: a screenshot sent from your computer to someonelses wouldn't matter if they didn't have your mods in order to view the screen shot.

as to the same version of ksp doesn't matter, as long as KLF works with that version: Note: I do not think KLF works with the Demo.
Then this is beyond awesome !!!
so with this mod you cannot bump into or see on surface other player ship?
